verses.verse: Become imitators of me, just as I also am of the Anointed King.
I applaud you, brothers, because you have always remembered me. And just as I gave the traditions over to you, you hold steady to them.
I want you to realize that the head of every man is the Anointed King. The head of a wife is the husband. The head of the Anointed King is God.
Every man praying or preaching having something down over his head shames his head.
Every wife praying or preaching with the head completely uncovered shames her own head. You see, it is one and the same with the wife having been shaved;
for if a wife is not completely covered, she also must cut her hair, but if it is shameful to a wife (the "to cut her hair or to be shaved" thing), she must be completely covered.
You see, a man certainly is not obligated for his head to be completely covered, being an image and the magnificence of God, but a woman is the magnificence of a man;
for a man is not from a woman, but a woman is from a man.
You see, also a man was not created because of the woman, but a woman because of the man.
Because of this, the woman is obligated to be having authority based on the head because of the angels.
More importantly, neither is a man separate from a woman, nor a woman separate from a man in the Master.
You see, even as the woman is from the man, so also is the man through the woman. All things are from God.
Judge among yourselves. Is it a thing that is appropriate for a woman to be praying to God completely uncovered?
Or doesn't even nature itself teach you that certainly if a man has long hair, it is no value to him?
But if a woman has long hair, it is magnificence for her because the long hair has been given to her for a cloak.
If anyone seems to be fond of quarreling, we don't have this type of policy, neither do the assemblies of God.
As I pass this order on, I don't applaud you, because you come together, not for the better, but for the worse.
You see, first of all, certainly as you come together in the assembly, I hear splits to be among you, and I trust some part of it;
for it is necessary for even sects to be among you so that the approved people will become shown among you.
So as you come together at the same place, it is not to eat a master dinner.
You see, each person takes his own dinner before others arrive during the time to eat. And there is one who is hungry, another who is drunk.

You see, do you not in any way have houses for the "to be eating and to be drinking" part? Or do you ignore the assembly of God and shame the people who don't have food? What should I say to you? Should I applaud you in this? I do not applaud you.
You see, I took in from the Master what I also turned in to you, that the Master Jesus took bread in the night that He was being turned in.
And after He was thankful, He tore it and said, "Take. Eat. This is My body, the body that is torn on your behalf. Do this for the reminder again of Me."
Similarly, also the cup after the time for them to eat dinner, saying, "This cup is the new treaty in My blood. Do this as often as you drink for the reminder again of Me."
You see, as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the death of the Master till whenever He comes.
In such a way, whoever eats this bread or drinks the cup of the Master in an undeserving manner will be confined for the body and blood of the Master.
A person must examine himself, and this is how he must eat from the bread and drink from the cup.
You see, the person who eats and drinks in an undeserving manner, eats and drinks judgment on himself, not considering the body of the Master to be different.
Because of this, many people among you are weak and sick, and an adequate amount are asleep.
You see, if we were considering ourselves to be wrong, we would not be judged.
Being judged by the Master, we are disciplined so that we might not be found guilty together with the world.
In such a way, my brothers, as you come together for the "to eat" part, wait for each other.
If anyone is hungry, he must eat in a house so that you don't come together into judgment. I will specifically arrange the rest of the things whenever I come.
